data

Class SQLDatabaseCustomerDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.SQLDatabaseCustomerDAO

  • public class SQLDatabaseCustomerDAO
extends java.lang.Object
    Project 2:

    The CustomerDAO class serves to collect, manipulate and persist data brought in from a AWS RDB hosted Postgresql database used as the main method of data storage for Project 2's coaster system. This will only work with Customers and strings as a query key.

    Created:
    11 May 2020, Barthelemy Martinon
    With assistance from:
    Modifications:
    11 May 2020, Barthelemy Martinon, Created class.
    12 May 2020, Barthelemy Martinon, Modified code to work around Strings for email instead of Integers for customerID. Commented out delete.
    Version:
    12 May 2020
    Author:
    Barthelemy Martinon With assistance from:

    • Method Detail

      • getConnectionUtil

        public ConnectionUtil getConnectionUtil()

      • setConnectionUtil

        public void setConnectionUtil(ConnectionUtil connectionUtil)

      • findById

        public Customer findById(java.lang.String inputEmail)
        Takes the database content, runs a hard-coded SELECT SQL query with WHERE clause to search for an entry with the specified integer for idnum. Returns null is nothing is found.
        Returns:
        c Customer with target idnum (or null)

      • findAll

        public java.util.ArrayList<Customer> findAll()
        Takes the database content, runs a hard-coded SELECT SQL query to obtain all entries. All "translated" entries are put into an ArrayList of Customers, which is returned.
        Returns:
        customerList Customer ArrayList of all database rows.

      • save

        public java.lang.String save(Customer obj)
        Takes a newly created Customer and runs a hard-coded INSERT SQL statement to add the Customer into the database as a table entry. Information found within the Customer given as input is collected and converted into the necessary values needed to complete the INSERT statement.
        Parameters:
        obj - New Customer created to be added
        Returns:
        outputstatus String value acting as a means to determine if the new Customer was successfully added

      • update

        public void update(Customer newObj,
                   java.lang.String inputEmail)
        Takes a Customer with updated information and an Integer that represents a target Customer's ID number and search through the customers table for a match. If one is found, the new Customer information overrides the target's information. (Mainly ticket information) If none are found, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        newObj - Customer to be updated
        inputEmail - String value representing target Customer email

      • delete

        public void delete(Customer obj)
        Takes a Customer and runs a hard-coded DELETE SQL statement to remove the entry from the database.
        Parameters:
        obj - Customer to be removed
